Node.definition: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= water coming down from the sky, which is indispensable for sustaining human life, but can be both refreshing and destructive
= a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time
= rain that falls during the first half of April, before the harvest; ► provides the moisture that is crucial for the grains to mature; ≈ regarded as a blessing from YHWH
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them
= type of cumulus cloud that accompanies rainstorms; ≈ often associated with God's glory
= water coming down from the sky, which is indispensable for sustaining human life, but can be both refreshing and destructive
= water that has fallen as rain
= any of various plants, herbs, grasses, seed bearing vegetation that can be consumed by human and/or animal

= a piece of land generally uninhabited by human beings, but where one can find wild animals and plants and trees; consists of grasslands, fields, desert, or forest; can be used for farming, pasturing animals, and hunting; often used in contrast to inhabited land such as cities or encampments.
= a small and portable physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing, ► functioning as an object of non sanctioned worship or divination

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= state of being non existent, implying that an existing object has been destroyed, or that an object exists in people's imagination only; ≈ regarded therefore as totally insignificant

= action by which humans communicate with the spirit world using a variety of means such as inspecting the liver of animals, shaking arrows, consulting teraphim, or casting lots; ≈ usually regarded as an evil practice that is to be condemned; responsibility of a prophet or king

Node.gloss: to receive as a vision|to have a vision
Node.definition: = process by which humans perceive something in a dream or trance, or as a supernatural apparition
literally: falsehood; hence: = state in which things that are being communicated are factually untrue
= process by which humans perceive a series of pictures and events in their minds; ≈ often regarded as a revelation from God; sometimes associated with things that disappear in a moment
literally: falsehood; hence: = state in which things that are being communicated are factually untrue

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= state in which a condition does not serve any purpose

Node.gloss: to comfort|to console|to reassure|to express sympathy|to bring relief
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities seek to make (other) humans feel relief after a time of grief, anxiety, or fear
= action by which a relatively large company of humans and/or animals move from one place to another, either or not with a clear destination in mind

= group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd

Node.gloss: to be afflicted|to be bothered|to be daunted
Node.definition: literally: to be bowed down; hence: = state in which humans are suffering hardship and trouble and unable to help themselves

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= process by which the anger (אַף) of humans and deities is aroused ◄ like a fire that is kindled
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
= someone with authority over a nation or ethnic group, ◄ described as a dominant male goat
= action by which deities or humans inflict a penalty on other deities, humans, animals, or objects, usually as retribution for an offence

Node.gloss: to take notice|to be mindful (of someone, something)
Node.definition: = action by which deities or humans take notice of the misfortune or suffering of (other) humans, plants, or objects and intervene in order to help
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

literally: YHWH (or one of the other names of God of a combination thereof) of Hosts; hence: = epithet of God with focus on his being in charge of the host of heavenly beings surrounding his throne, praising him, and carrying out his will in earth; ≈ as an epithet it relates to God's power and control of the cosmos as the divine king and warrior

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a large group of domesticated mammals that moves and stays together, either in an enclosure or in a open area ◄ usually sheep or goats, but can also include camels or cattle

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district
= causative action by which humans or deities make objects or (other) humans different from what they were before

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= large domesticated solid hoofed quadruped; stockily built in comparison to today's horses, with shorter heads and thicker necks; about 122–142 cm tall, and 2.1 m long; its coat varies from dark to pale brown; it eats plants; ◄ Equus caballus; ► used in battle, both to ride and for pulling chariots; ≈ symbolic of military might; associated with the sun, which was said to ride across the sky in a chariot
= state in which humans, deities, animals and plants are respected by others, implying beauty, vigor and authority
= armed conflict between different countries or different groups within a country
= small, pointed object ► driven into a wall or the ground and used for hanging things on or securing something in place; ≈ associated with firmness and security
= a strong but flexible piece of wood to which a string is attached for the firing of arrows, ► used for hunting or as weapon of war
= armed conflict between different countries or different groups within a country

Node.gloss: to come out of (a group)|to be one of a group
Node.definition: literally: to come out (of a group); hence: = process by which humans are a member of a certain community
= state in which humans or objects are jointly involved in an event
= a human being, animal, or supernatural being who is renowned for his characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof
= action by which humans tread heavily and noisily on somebody or something; ► usually with the purpose of killing, destroying, desecrating, and/or humiliating

= wet soil;◄ moistened by rain or because of its proximity to a body of water; ► can be used for pottery or bricks; ≈ regarded as cheap, easily obtainable and workable material for making basic items; otherwise as a valueless substance or an obstacle for movement
= area outside of living quarters; ► used as thoroughfare
= armed conflict between different countries or different groups within a country
= action by which humans or deities engage in a confrontation with (other) humans
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to put to shame|to bring shame
Node.definition: = causative action by which someone causes someone else to forfeit the respect of the community, by provoking a situation that is not in accordance to that person's status
= action by which humans ride on a domestic animal such as a donkey (חֲמֹור) or a horse (סוּס) or in a chariot (מֶרְכָּבָה)

= large domesticated solid hoofed quadruped; stockily built in comparison to today's horses, with shorter heads and thicker necks; about 122–142 cm tall, and 2.1 m long; its coat varies from dark to pale brown; it eats plants; ◄ Equus caballus; ► used in battle, both to ride and for pulling chariots; ≈ symbolic of military might; associated with the sun, which was said to ride across the sky in a chariot
= causative action by which a deity gives humans strength and power, probably both physically and mentally

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household
= man; ◄ eleventh son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and first son of Rachel (רָחֵל) ► father of Ephraim (אֶפְרַיִם) and Manasseh (מְנַשֶּׁה) each founder of a tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the help of humans in need, whether in military, civil or judicial contexts
read שׁוב

Node.gloss: to be merciful|to have mercy (on someone)|to have compassion (on someone)
Node.definition: = state in which humans or deities feel compassion for other, ◄ caused by affection for that person and/or the lack of well being of that person; ► this feeling is usually translated into action: a person who feels compassion may forgive an offence, refrain from aggression and/or punishment, or revoke punishment
= a linker introducing a propostion that contains the content of what precedes
= action by which someone makes a conscious decision to dismiss a certain object, person, or deity as inadequate, faulty, or otherwise unacceptable
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions
= a human being, animal, or supernatural being who is renowned for his characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof
= reference to the northern kingdom of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) of which Ephraim was the most important tribe
= state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

= dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy
mainly in poetical texts: = state in which humans feel and show great joy
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= causative action by which humans or deities cause humans or animals to come together as a group for a common purpose

= action by which humans scatter seeds or plant young plants in a field so that they may grow into a new crop; ≈ associated with the concept of investing in order to get a return; also associated with reproduction and perpetuation

Node.gloss: to remember|to call to mind|to be mindful|to bear in mind|to consider
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities reprocess information that is stored in their mind

Node.gloss: to be alive|to become alive|to live
Node.definition: = to be alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
literally: to turn; hence: = action by which animals, humans, or deities move back to a location where they have been before

Node.gloss: to take back|to bring back|to return|to put back|to restore (something)
Node.definition: literally: to turn; hence: = causative action by which animals, humans, deities cause (other) animals, humans, or objects to move back to a location where they have been before

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= nation and their territory; ◄ regarded as founded by one of the sons of Ham (חָם) with the same name
= nation; ◄ located in Northern Mesopotamia with Nineveh (נִינְוֵה) as its capital; regarded as descendants of Shem (שֵׁם)
= causative action by which humans or deities cause humans or animals to come together as a group for a common purpose

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= area on east side of the Jordan (יַרְדֵּן) ◄ supposedly named after Gilead, son of Makir (מָכִיר) tribe of Manasseh (מְנַשֶּׁה)
= range of mountains; ◄ north of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) ► known for the cedar (אֶרֶז) and other trees growing there
literally: to be found (in a place); hence: = state in which humans or objects are located in a certain place
= a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water
= a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape
= a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water
= a ridge of water curling into an arched form between two depressions in open water
= process by which objects containing liquid essential to their existence are caused to lose these liquids ◄ due to some external or internal cause
= a river ◄ flowing through Egypt from south to north; ► overflowing its banks each year and providing fertility for the fields on both sides; ≈ generally associated with Egypt's power and prosperity
= causative process by which a condition is caused to decrease in intensity
= state in which humans or deities have an elevated status, either in their own eyes or in the eyes of other people, ≈ which can either be good or bad, depending on whether this status is justified
= nation; ◄ located in Northern Mesopotamia with Nineveh (נִינְוֵה) as its capital; regarded as descendants of Shem (שֵׁם)
literally: staff; hence: = state of authority over someone else symbolized by a scepter
= nation and their territory; ◄ regarded as founded by one of the sons of Ham (חָם) with the same name
= causative action by which a deity gives humans strength and power, probably both physically and mentally
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
literally: name; hence: = the information that is generally known about a person or deity, which may either be good or bad and has a direct impact on the way this person or deity is regarded
= process by which humans or deities follow a certain pattern of behavior, ◄ which is described as their journey through life
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
